skill.name: rust-cargo-assistant
skill.description: Cargo build system, crate management, and Rust project configuration assistance.
skill.summary: Cargo build system, crate management, and Rust project configuration assistance.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only instructional markdown documentation about Rust Cargo usage. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution. Behavior perfectly matches stated purpose.

content.user_title: Get expert Cargo and Rust help
content.value_statement: Rust developers spend hours learning Cargo commands and configuration patterns. This skill provides instant expert guidance for project setup, dependency management, and build optimization without searching through documentation.
actual_capabilities: Initialize and configure Cargo projects with best practices
Add, update, and manage crate dependencies with semantic versioning
Configure build profiles, features, and optimization settings
Set up multi-crate workspaces and cross-compilation targets
Troubleshoot compilation errors and dependency conflicts
Prepare projects for publishing to crates.io
limitations: Cannot execute cargo commands directly on the system
Cannot access or modify local project files
Cannot install Rust toolchains or dependencies
Provides guidance only, not hands-on project changes

use_cases.title: Learn Cargo basics
use_cases.description: Quickly understand project creation, dependency addition, and basic build commands.

use_cases.title: Optimize build config
use_cases.description: Fine-tune release profiles, enable LTO, and reduce binary size for production.

use_cases.title: Publish to crates.io
use_cases.description: Prepare packages with correct metadata and follow publishing best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Create new project
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a new Rust library project and configure Cargo.toml with proper metadata.

prompt_templates.title: Add dependencies
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I add the tokio crate with full features and serde as an optional dependency?

prompt_templates.title: Optimize release
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure my release profile for maximum optimization with LTO and minimal binary size.

prompt_templates.title: Fix compilation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me resolve linker errors when building a project with C dependencies on Linux.

best_practices: Commit Cargo.lock for binaries to ensure reproducible builds across machines.
Use workspaces to share dependency versions and reduce compilation times.
Enable LTO and set codegen-units = 1 in release profiles for maximum optimization.
anti_patterns: Avoid committing Cargo.lock for libraries since downstream users manage their own versions.
Do not use loose version specifications like version = ">= 0.1" which can cause breakages.
Avoid over-specifying platform-specific dependencies when standard library features suffice.

faq.question: What Rust edition does this skill support?
faq.answer: All editions from 2015 to 2021 are covered with configuration examples for each.

faq.question: What are the Cargo version requirements?
faq.answer: Examples work with Cargo 1.65 and newer. Some features like workspace dependencies require newer versions.

faq.question: Can this skill help with existing projects?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides guidance on analyzing, debugging, and improving existing Cargo projects.

faq.question: Is any data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No, this is a prompt-only skill that provides guidance without accessing files or making network calls.

faq.question: Why am I getting dependency resolution errors?
faq.answer: Common causes include conflicting version requirements, missing features, or incompatible crate editions.

faq.question: How does this compare to cargo-generate?
faq.answer: This skill explains concepts and configuration while cargo-generate scaffolds projects from templates.
